newsitem.title: USA: Open Market expects Folio deal done by March-end.
newsitem.headline: Open Market expects Folio deal done by March-end.

text.p: Open Market Inc officials told reporters Friday the company expects its $45 million acquisition of Reed Elsevier's Folio Corp subsidiary to close in the first quarter ending March 31.

The purchase would be paid in the form of $25 million in equity, $15 million in cash and $5 milllion in either cash or equity depending on post closing events that were not disclosed, the Cambridge, Mass.-based Internet commerce management software company said.
"We are looking to close this acquisition...We are very hopeful that it will close this quarter," Open Market's chief Financial Officer Regina Sommers said.
She added "You're going to see a charge in Q1 for the amount of the purchase price that is allocated to in-process R&D (research & development)...That will be a non-recurring one-time charge.
"We do expect some dilution in 1997 and some strong accretion in 1998 from this acquisition," she said.
